intro: Astragalus lasiosemius, commonly known as the woolly milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in racemes, which are typically pollinated by insects. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Astragalus lasiosemius is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
